components.description: The letter B, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter B

components.description: The letter Q, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter Q

description: The Caribbean Netherlands, a group of islands in the Caribbean Sea. The design for this emoji is shown as the flag for Bonaire on most platforms.
title: Flag: Caribbean Netherlands

emoji_net_data.definition: The Flag for Caribbean Netherlands emoji is a sequence of the ?? Regional Indicator Symbol LetÂ­ter B and ?? Regional Indicator Symbol LetÂ­te http://emojipedia.org/flag-for-caribbean-netherlands/
emoji_net_data.name: Caribbean Netherlands

bn:13778626a: From or in the countryside or connected with it.
Of, from or pertaining to the countryside (adjective).

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:02080565n: The Caribbean Netherlands refers to a group of three special municipalities of the Netherlands that are located in the Caribbean Sea: the islands of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba, which are also known as the BES islands.
The three special municipalities of the Netherlands that are located in the Caribbean: Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba.
Grouping of the Caribbean islands of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba, part of the Netherlands
The three Caribbean islands of Bonaire, Sint Eustatius and Saba that became special municipalities of the Netherlands after dissolution of the Netherlands Antilles
Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba; the Caribbean Netherlands.

bn:00011965n: An island in the southern part of the Caribbean Sea off the north coast of Venezuela (12Â° 11? 7? N, 68Â° 15? 43? W), which is part of the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
Island in the Caribbean, part of the Netherlands
An island in the southern part of the Caribbean Sea off the west coast of Venezuela, a special municipality of the Netherlands.
A popular island resort in the Netherlands Antilles
Bonaire is a Caribbean island which, together with Aruba and CuraÃ§ao, forms the group known as the ABC islands, located off the north coast of South America near the western part of Venezuela.
An island in the Caribbean Sea, part of the Netherlands

bn:00023236n: The collective body of a nation or state as politically organized, or as exercising political functions.
The territory of a nation, especially an independent nation state or formerly independent nation; a political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

Nations is often used synonymously with ethnic group, but although ethnicity is now one of the most important aspects of cultural or social identity for the members of most nations, people with the same ethnic origin may live in different nation-states and be treated as members of separate nations for that reason.
Political organisation with a centralized independent government
An organized political community, living under a government
Nation has various meanings, and the meaning has changed over time.
A state is an organized community living under one government.
A political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

A people permanently occupying a fixed territory bound together by common law, habits and custom into one body politic exercising, through the medium of an organized government, independent sovereignty and control over all persons and things within its boundaries, unless or until authority is ceded to a federation or union of other states.
The people who live in a nation or country
A politically organized body of people under a single government
A state is a nonphysical juridical entity of the international legal system that is represented by one centralized government that has supreme independent authority over a geographic area.
The geographic area under the control of a political state.

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
apple_vendor_description: The flag of the Caribbean Netherlands on Apple devices is rendered with a vibrant blue field, featuring crisp white stars and a prominent red stripe. Appleâ€™s signature glossy 3D shading imbues the flag with a sense of depth and realism, making each element pop with lifelike texture. This emoji, with its smooth gradients and soft rounded edges, signifies a connection to or interest in Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba.
